content:
Hello! Thanks for visiting my site! ðŸ‘‹
I am a mathematician working on data science related topics such as anomaly detection, meta-learning, streaming data and statistical learning related research projects. I conduct research on theoretical and real-world problems. For example, visualizing anomalies in high dimensions is a very tricky business. How can we reduce dimensions in a way that anomalies are highlighted or brought to the forefront? (For details, see dobin).
I come to statistical learning from a pure mathematics background. My PhD was in mean curvature flow, which lies in the intersection of partial differential equations and differential geometry. I like to bring my geometric intuition to solve data science problems. More details can be found on my CV.
summary:

title: Sevvandi Kandanaarachchi

content:
We humans leave such a lot of junk in space. If youâ€™re interested in space junk, you can listen to two podcasts that I co-conducted with Anthony Mays on the topic. These episodes were part of the ACEMS podcast series Random Sample and can be found here.
In the first episode, we talk about space junk and one of the related research papers that I wrote with Dr Shannon Ryan from DST Group and Prof Kate Smith-Miles.
In the second episode we interview Shannon and Prof Bill Schonberg, two space junk experts about space craft shields and the lastest technology.
summary:

In the first episode, we talk about space junk and one of the related research papers that I wrote with Dr Shannon Ryan from DST Group and Prof Kate Smith-Miles.
title: Space junk podcast
